summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting the interview of Larry Visoski, a former pilot for Jeffrey Epstein, conducted on November 12, 2020. Visoski describes his employment, flight operations, and interactions with U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) officers, including specific officers Epstein was friendly with. He denies knowledge of CBP officers assisting in trafficking underage passengers.

persons.name: Larry Visoski
persons.context: Interviewed by the FBI about his employment with Epstein, his duties as a pilot, and his observations of Epstein's interactions with CBP officers.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Visoski's former employer. Described as interacting frequently with CBP officers, sometimes arguing about immigration procedures for his passengers.

persons.name: David Rodgers
persons.context: The other full-time pilot employed by Epstein. Initially the Chief Pilot before Visoski took over in the early 2000s.

persons.name: Glen McGorty
persons.context: Present during Visoski's FBI interview as his legal counsel.

persons.name: Danielle Giffuni
persons.context: Present during Visoski's FBI interview as his legal counsel.

persons.name: Daniel Zelenko
persons.context: Present during Visoski's FBI interview as his legal counsel.

connections.description: Epstein hired Visoski as a pilot in the mid-1990s. Visoski was responsible for flying and maintaining Epstein's aircraft.
Epstein employed Rodgers as a full-time pilot. Rodgers was initially the Chief Pilot.
Both were pilots employed by Jeffrey Epstein. Visoski was the lower-ranking pilot until he became Chief Pilot in the early 2000s.
McGorty was one of Visoski's attorneys present during his FBI interview.
Giffuni was one of Visoski's attorneys present during his FBI interview.
Zelenko was one of Visoski's attorneys present during his FBI interview.

events.title: FBI Interview of Larry Visoski
events.description: FBI Special Agents and an Assistant U.S. Attorney interview former Epstein pilot Larry Visoski via video conference regarding his employment and observations.

events.title: Visoski Hired by Epstein
events.description: Larry Visoski is hired by Jeffrey Epstein as a pilot, initially as the lower-ranking of two pilots.

events.title: Visoski Becomes Chief Pilot
events.description: Larry Visoski takes over from David Rodgers as the Chief Pilot for Jeffrey Epstein's aircraft operations.

keyFacts: Larry Visoski, Epstein's former pilot, was interviewed by the FBI in November 2020 as part of the investigation.
Visoski described Epstein as being friendly with specific CBP officers, sometimes asking them to keep offices open late or giving them helicopter rides to his private island.
Epstein would sometimes intervene with CBP officers when they questioned female passengers with foreign passports, arguing it was only an immigration issue.
Visoski stated he had no knowledge of any CBP officer assisting Epstein in trafficking underage passengers.
The document notes the presence of multiple redacted names of CBP officers and an Assistant U.S. Attorney, indicating ongoing investigative interest in these individuals.
